<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_0586_til_post">
    <x_0586_til_post action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE">
        <category display_value="OOB">7cb680be1b8154908ed631d7dc4bcb37</category>
        <github_id>78</github_id>
        <github_url>https://github.com/iamkalai/SNTIL/issues/78</github_url>
        <message>Have you seen the object dump of transform map source variable? If you are involved in building transform maps that require good amount of logging, there are quite a lot of useful attributes available for your usage.

eg: source.setValue("sys_import_state_comment", "Your custom error here");

sys_import_row - Row number of import row
sys_import_state_comment - Add comment in import row
sys_row_error - Track error message/code in sys_import_set_row_error table
sys_import_state - State of import row (Inserted, Updated)
sys_id - Import set row sys_id
sys_import_set - Import set sys_id
import_set_run - Import set run sys_id
sys_transform_map - Transform map sys_id
sys_target_table - Target table of transform
sys_target_sys_id - Target record sys_id
sys_class_name - Source table or import table name</message>
        <number>TIL0001079</number>
        <status>old</status>
        <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by>
        <sys_created_on>2020-11-05 12:45:16</sys_created_on>
        <sys_id>4824a5e52f54e01051dad5f62799b623</sys_id>
        <sys_mod_count>2</sys_mod_count>
        <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by>
        <sys_updated_on>2021-03-31 06:12:28</sys_updated_on>
        <title>Transform map script variables</title>
    </x_0586_til_post>
</record_update>
